website_summaries.verdict: Dispenses both foaming and soap and hand sanitizer, although the latter must be diluted in order to work.
pros: Settings for both high and low foam levels
Foaming makes washing fun for kids and ensures they get the right amount
cons: Quit working for some customers after a few weeks -  some suggest being cautious of battery compartment when filling

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Game changer for kids!
customer_reviews.text: If you have small children, this is a game changer for hand washing time, especially during these times of quarantine. I have a three year old and a six year old and in between climbing onto the step stool, trying to reach the knob for the water, using two hands for a standard soap pump...it’s an ordeal. Now they can just wave their little hands under the dispenser and voila! It’s easy to load with batteries, easy to fill up with soap (you’ll need the foam soap specifically, or to dilute regular soap), and easy to use. the only (very) slight downside: it’s quite loud when it dispenses soap. I might just get one for every bathroom in the house.
customer_reviews.author: STEPHENRH

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working at 2 mos!
customer_reviews.text: I kept it in the kitchen and used it daily. It worked for 2.5 mos and then nothing. Stopped working yesterday. Just stopped. Replaced the batteries with brand new ones... Still Nothing. Return window closed. Not worth it if it’s not going to last! DON’T WASTE UR MONEY!
customer_reviews.author: SaMi

customer_reviews.title: Too much hassle
customer_reviews.text: Wasted money. Doesn’t work all the time. Waiting for someone to invent everything during this coronavirus time to make sense and NOT waste my time or money.
customer_reviews.author: Keami Hepburn

customer_reviews.title: I recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Omg I love it. I was looking for a dispenser so my kids (3&6) specifically the little one can get soap on their own without calling me over to help them pump a dollop of soap in their hands and this is perfect!! I also wanted this bc I was tired of the actual soap pump looking so dirty bc soap gets stuck around the crevices of the bottle. I’ve included pics of the old dirty looking soap pump vs the new one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It was good while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: I bought this soap dispenser at the end of March because of the pandemic. I thought it would help with hand-washing. And it did. It was great. We used it at the kitchen sink, so it was used often. It has been refilled with no problems until today. This morning when I tried to wash my hands nothing happened. I tried the power button. Nothing. I replaced the batteries. Still nothing. I'm disappointed that it didn't last but worked long enough to outlast the return window.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working within about one month!
customer_reviews.text: This product worked well initially, but then within about a month, the product stopped working at all. The lights were still operational and we changed the batteries, but nothing made the pump come back to life. I was dismayed to see that the return window had already closed.......
customer_reviews.author: Angus Filch

customer_reviews.title: Seller stands behind the product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these at separate times. I really like how they work. There are many 5 star reviews that explain why they deserve the review. I won't repeat them. I am writing this because I had a problem with one of the units sensor system. It was after the return period so I went to my order history and selected contact seller. I asked about the warranty. A short time later I got a reply of a possible fix. It did not work and unit quit entirely. I let the seller know. They sent a priority mail replacement. Things happen. Electronics fail. The response is the important thing, and the seller's was exactly what you would hope for.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: if it only  worked for longer then a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: My need is for 2 units. I've ordered 3 in total as one of the first units stopped working. Look, these are pretty cheaply made and honestly, what should be the expectation? 6 months? In any case, I exchanged one of my original 2 units to only have the replacement stop working after a few weeks. The problem is, what is the alternative if you want to refill your own sanitizer? I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS BRAND AT ALL
customer_reviews.author: michael costa

customer_reviews.title: Fatal Design Problem
customer_reviews.text: Battery location is a problem whereas easily get wet and the whole product then becoming malfunction
customer_reviews.author: Jocelyn Yip

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: This dispenser was purchased after a different brand was purchased initially and then returned. I was afraid this one would look too chunky on the kitchen counter where most of my items are stainless. It really blends in well and looks great. The dispenser works perfectly, allowing me to adjust the output. The foam soap dispenses so foamy and fluffy it feels like whipped cream on my hands. It actually produces the foam so much better than the original bottle from the soap manufacturer. Very happy with this purchase, and I am off to order 3 others to place in all the bathrooms too.
customer_reviews.author: LauraP320

customer_reviews.title: I Love it..
customer_reviews.text: After installing the battery, had a little hard time to turn on since that on switch is little difficult to understand, still I don't know how to control the flow. Other than that I works very well. It is very responsive. Make cleaning hand for kids little fun and you don't need to touch it. I have been filling the target brand foaming liquid and it works very well. Have not tried the regular hand soap with water. Instructions to control the liquid should be improved.Overall happy with purchase and very needed item specially during the COVID-19.
customer_reviews.author: Hemal Shah

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with this foaming dispenser
customer_reviews.text: Unit does very well in dispensing foam soap consistently. Compared to our previous SimpleHuman gel dispensing unit, this is leaps and bounds above it. The sensor on this is accurate, the amount is consistent, and it has simple to use controls. I've been using the Method foam soap refills and according to the product listing I can also just mix gel soap + water, but I have not tried that. Overall, was so satisfied with this unit that I bought a second one for the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Yucky hands be gone!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting something like this for awhile. And since our wedding/ shower got canceled, we are treating ourselves. This is perfect for our kitchen. For years I've been trying to figure out a way to wash my hands after handling raw meat; and this is the solution! The motion detection isn't that sensitive so being close to it won't set it off. You have to be directly under it. I would highly reccomend.
customer_reviews.author: ConfessionsOfaShopahlic

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: A bit pricier than some of the other brands/models but I think the price difference is worth it. The volume settings are an important feature that the cheaper ones didn't have. The motion detection is very good and foam dispensing quick. I've owned a few auto soap dispenser and this one looks the best and so far operates the best.
customer_reviews.author: LN

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I wasn’t able to get it to work at first because I was using rechargeable batteries. Once I got other batteries in, it worked like a charm. We have a small bathroom and I was worried it would be too sensitive when working around the sink. It only goes off when you put your hand right under it. I also like how it has two flow options. We use the lower setting and it’s just the right amount. It also has a very sturdy base that keeps it from being easily knocked around. Impressed!
customer_reviews.author: TheRuhlz4

customer_reviews.title: Awesome foamer!
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit hunky, but foam dispensers require a lot of volume to contain diluted soap. The size can be a lot more compact though. Battery required is 4 AA alkaline. Rechargeable AA does not work. I wish that it could! Had it for a couple days now and I'm very happy with it so far. Cannot comment on how long the battery will last for now. The foam coming out is smooth and silky, perfect amount.
customer_reviews.author: Brian N.

customer_reviews.title: No issues and it's used a lot
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 and so far no issues after some time and lots of use from both. I have noticed that sometimes if you don't move your hand away fast enough, it will dispense another amount of soap. The two different settings for amounts is very nice to have. Easy to refill and batteries last quite a while, just don't use cheap batteries and it will go for a long time. The design makes it easy to clean when you want to clean it.
customer_reviews.author: tyler and mary

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in One month
customer_reviews.text: It worked for about four weeks and then stopped working. I can turn the unit on and off but the sensor stopped working. It worked great while it was working and my kids thought it was super fun to wash their hands. But for $27 only last for a month is not worth it. Update, the seller was very nice and refunded me money right away. so here I change the rating from 1 star to 4 star. Although, I wish the product could last me longer, we all loved using it. It makes less mess and was super fun for my children to wash their hands.
customer_reviews.author: Lambert

customer_reviews.title: COVID FREE!
customer_reviews.text: I've used a few auto pumps and this one is nice. Keeps my hands from touching anything is really nice during this COVID pandemic. Hands free so nobody needs to touch a soap dispenser. I do like the 2 modes that are easily toggle between how much it dispenses CONS I think the power down option needs to be longer. Some people may accidentally turn it off because they hand their finger down and do not understand it is an auto dispenser. Battery placement was not very intuitive, had to read manual for how to install batteries.
customer_reviews.author: V.R.

customer_reviews.title: Works when it wants to
customer_reviews.text: Great product - when it works. I bought this in March and it worked for about a month. Then it just stoped. Despite replacing batteries it wouldn’t work. I tried to do a return/replacement and I think because of Covid they wouldn’t let me. I had put it away and then I moved it one day and it worked again! Now it sits in our counter with a regular pump soap bc again, it only works when it wants to which is about 40% of the time. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley T

customer_reviews.title: Great Company
customer_reviews.text: When Covid hit in March, I needed something to help me feel safe. I hit on the idea of a touchless soap dispenser. I chose Eakey's because it was moderately priced, attractive and had good reviews. I liked it so much that I ordered one for my daughter, and a third for the powder room. Sadly, my 3rd dispenser worked, but sputtered a bit if it hadn't been used recently. I contacted the company, and a replacement quickly arrived. That's customer service! The dispensers provide just the right amount of foam to wash hands without wasting the soap. The 3 parts water and one part liquid soap work well, and is economical to boot.
customer_reviews.author: Mystery Reader

customer_reviews.title: Not working properly anymore after 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: It was ok the first week I got it, so happy with it, then yesterday I refilled it with soap and very disappointed that I’m getting very little dispensing of soap. What could have gone wrong? Hope to get a replacement so it’s worth what I paid for. It took me a while to make a decision which touch less soap dispenser to buy. I already discarded the box and really feel bad if I can’t even return it.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Makes Washing Hands Fun :)
customer_reviews.text: We had a regular pump foamer, and it kept clogging up and getting dirty. I figured we'd give this a try. The kids ... and the adults, love it. I just dilute regular hand soap. A little goes a long way. I'll probably buy a second one for the basement bathroom too. Funny ... looking over the questions about the on/off button helped me out. Turn it off to handle it, or you'll get foamed reaching to move it (I may have done that a few times).
customer_reviews.author: *BlackhamBunch*

customer_reviews.title: It stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I brought 2 of this in February, three months in, my first one stopped working. After multiple attempts of changing batteries and shutting it down and restarting it; soap will not come out. There was a green light but no soap would come out. My second device stopped working last week with the same problem. I see the green light, placed my hand there and the soap just will not come out. I am very disappointed with this product. It was a waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Chan

customer_reviews.title: Saves soap
customer_reviews.text: With all that’s going on in the world we all know soap is a hot commodity now. That being said I hate wasting it. My kid always uses a ton of soap. This dispenser allows u to dilute your soap so it foams. It’s easy to use and it looks modern and good in my guest bathroom. I’m thinking about getting them for all the bathrooms. It’s easy to use, you just put soap and water, mix and that’s it. So far the battery has lasted a week so with more use we will see how long it takes to drain. But so far we love it.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Amador

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working about a month!
customer_reviews.text: This product stopped working after 5 weeks of usage. The light and sensor were operating, but the soap just won't dispense. I have tried replacing with new batteries which didn't fix the problem, so it is clearly not the battery issue. My return window is closed and I'm unable to return this broken product.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Wu

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in a few months- bad touch sensitivity
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working in a few months. The power button is the worst touch sensitive thing I've ever seen. I had to spent half an hour to get it to turn on or change the volume of the soap. But then you suddenly touch the top and it changes volume again and you have to again spend another half hour to try to get the button to register the touch and change the volume again.
customer_reviews.author: Amir

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: The button still lights up, but won't dispense. *** Update. The company reached out to me and sent a replacement. It's currently working. However, when I put in batteries, it lit up but didn't initially dispense.
customer_reviews.author: ASF

customer_reviews.title: Just waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Keep your money and don't buy this awful product its just dont work like the description!
customer_reviews.author: Golden Boy

customer_reviews.title: Makes Foaming Soap Last Longer
customer_reviews.text: After pump dispensers kept breaking after one refill, we wanted something less wasteful. These dispensers make the soap last longer and the foam is finer. Also, support from the vendor was excellent. We received a couple with bad check valves (obviously a manufacturing error). The vendor cross shipped the replacements immediately and all units work great.
customer_reviews.author: V. Dean

customer_reviews.title: stopped working
customer_reviews.text: It took a while to get the right water/soap ratio to work. 2 1/2 months later, it stopped working. Tried all of the sellers suggestions but nothing. Missed the return date so I am out $32
customer_reviews.author: leonard v shimko

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and keeps area neat and clean
customer_reviews.text: This soap dispenser looks nice on my counter and does not drip (saving soap) after dispensing keeping surrounding area neat and clean. It was very easy to setup. I would recommend. Note: I added four small rubber spacer on the underside of base (as I do with all flat objects on my kitchen/bath counters) to prevent water from pooling around it. This makes for easier cleanup... Lift dispenser and wipe counter. No need to also wipe dispenser.
customer_reviews.author: Linday12

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work right with hand sanitizer
customer_reviews.text: Did not produce foam when diluted as instructed with hand sanitizer. Sanitizer sputters out and you need 2-3 “applications” to get a sufficient amount.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Hastings

customer_reviews.title: easy to install and put together
customer_reviews.text: this is the third soap dispenser that I have purchased and by far my favorite, Make sure you have the soap mixture correct. The first time I used it, my mixture was too thick and it struggled. Fixed that issue and have never had a problem. It is stylish and easy to clean. Absolutely love it, I will by two more for other rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Rain Hankins

customer_reviews.title: No more soap waste from my kids!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good soap dispenser. You can adjust how much soap you get and you can use it with regular soap also. It always senses your hand there. This stopped my 3 year old from pouring out whole bottles of soap just to wash her hands. Thank goodness! Definitely recommend to any mom with a mischievous 3 year old
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Jacobs/Haley Cain

customer_reviews.title: two of 5 failed before first refill.
customer_reviews.text: 2 of 5 failed before first refill. I would not recommend,
customer_reviews.author: Fairclge

customer_reviews.title: Good but almost too sensitive
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 3 yo son’s washing hands routine. I found it he uses it easy and wash his hands well now. But it’s almost too sensitive for motion detection, if he cross his hands unintentionally under it, it still pushes soap. You just have find a good position to put dispenser around the sink! There are two settings for amount of soap, by just touch of the top part.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Used about a month and it stopped working. The lights were still operational but didn’t dispense. Replaced with new batteries, but nothing made the pump come back to life, and the return window had already closed......
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Just as the headline states. Broke after 3 months of moderate use. Doesn't dispense soap. Would not buy again, and I do not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Iago

customer_reviews.title: LOVE the function and design! Less product dispensed would be nice.
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as I expected. I wish the amounted dispensed was a fraction less (like 50% less) but it still works. The size doesn’t feel overwhelming large next to my kitchen faucet. Would like to add one to the guest bathroom and children’s bathroom!
customer_reviews.author: vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Cool Soap dispenser
customer_reviews.text: This is my first automatic soap dispenser and it’s pretty cool. It’s sturdy and has a nice white color, looks clean and matches my bathroom. You can adjust the dispensary level but tapping on the power button. The dispenser is pretty sensitive so just be careful. I didn’t have foaming soap on hand so I just mixed my regular liquid hand soap and a bit of water and it works!
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Simple & efficient
customer_reviews.text: I'd been looking for a motion sensor foam hand soap dispenser. This fits the bill, and is reasonably priced. It is clean, and has a streamlined profile. Aesthetically, it would serve well in college student's apartment, or in a casually decorated bathroom. It isn't fancy, but it dispenses soap nicely, and allows for adjustment to the amount of soap dispensed.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Nazaroff

customer_reviews.title: These units along with its customer service works very well.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these. 1 works lovely. The other stopped working after about 2 months of use. Changed batteries, did basic troubleshooting...but just won't work. But for the 1 that does work...it works very well. Additionally, what works even better than these really useful automatic soap dispensers... Is the customer service of this provider. Very exceptional customer service as they resolve the 2nd system with a no hassle replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Shimon Wright

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: So I gave this a try and it actually works well. Washing my hands a hundred times a day, I wanted to get a touchless solution. My concern was that it would not shoot enough soap at once; however, the volume is sufficient and it does as described.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: High hopes. Bought two. First broke after 1 week, second broke after 4 weeks.
customer_reviews.text: When it worked, it made hand washing so much easier and fun. Sadly they both broke after some usage. No idea why it broke, just stopped working. Battery was not the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Han

customer_reviews.title: Hands free especially if you have concerns for Covid
customer_reviews.text: I have only had it for 2 weeks but it works great. I use a 33% mixture of soap to water 4 oz. soap 8 oz. of water and it works great (some soaps will give you more foam (Amazon brand doesn't foam as much as Soft Soap brand) but birth are acceptable. Would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: tomtsg

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt turn on
customer_reviews.text: It took me a while for it to turn on the first time. Eventually, I had to add more soap after using it therefore, I turned it off. Once I filled it up it wouldn’t turn on again. I really like it but it doesn't turn back on. I recharged my batteries and even tried new ones. Batteries are in correctly, its closed correctly but doesn’t turn on and Ive been trying for a few days now. It only worked for a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: wow
customer_reviews.text: its very nice and i am enjoying using it but its smaller then i thought thats why it gets 4 stars,but props for everything else it works as intended and i would buy again if it was a larger size but so far it works in all aspects thanks
customer_reviews.author: Nad

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Perfect soap dispenser. Fast and easy to use. The built quality is excellent. It has two modes to dispense which is really great. Make sure to use this with the foaming hand wash. The touch function is really good.
customer_reviews.author: amazing_buyer_6699

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this dispenser! I have another automatic dispenser where the battery is located at the base and it will work for a few months and then stop working. The battery for this one is located on the middle so it won’t get water damage.It creates a nice foam and has two different settings.
customer_reviews.author: Lena t le

customer_reviews.title: Better then expected
customer_reviews.text: I got this for the guest bathroom. I did not set the bar high when I placed the order. Boy, was I in for a surprise. This is the greatest addition to my house. It picks up motion right away and dispenses the perfect amount of soap. Definitely does not disappoint!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Rae

customer_reviews.title: Trashed
customer_reviews.text: Broke! We used this for 3 months and it failed to sense our hand...We kept it clean, rinsed it out weekly, no avail. Cooks illustrated recommends simple human. If you really want one go to them. I do have SimpleHuman and it lasts. ..Waste of money on this Aeakey dispenser.
customer_reviews.author: Sebatech

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working at 5 months
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these for my house. The first one purchased in March 2020 has already stopped working, which means it lasted about 5 months. My toddler and I liked this dispenser, and I’m bummed it didn’t last longer since it’s expensive.
customer_reviews.author: am1

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work after a week
customer_reviews.text: Worked for about one week and now it doesn’t. I’ve tried everything anyone has suggested to make it work to no avail. At this point I’ve invested so much time to fix it, I feel stupid. To make matters worse I can no longer return. :(
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Mashburn

customer_reviews.title: Awesome item. Use any soap
customer_reviews.text: I love it!! Easy setup. 2 settings for the amount of soap dispensed. You can use any soap, just dilute it with water when filling. It foams great. My family has 4 right now, will update later about how long it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Tavia Vice

customer_reviews.title: Short lived.
customer_reviews.text: I used this soap dispenser for about 6 weeks and it worked great!!! Then I was gone and no one used it for about a month. It’s has not worked since my return. I have been trying to resurrect it: new batteries, different soap, plain warm water. Nothing seems to get it going properly again. The motor runs but I can only get a couple half hearted drips of foam about once a day. I’m sad.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this dispenser Aug 12 2020. It was amazing; Its one of the few dispensers that uses all types of soaps to operate. One morning recently There was sudden death. The power and function lights still worked but it didn't dispense anymore. I changed batteries and made sure the sensor wasn't dirty. Nothing! Very disappointing
customer_reviews.author: GAVIN

customer_reviews.title: Works exact as advertised !
customer_reviews.text: I bought it because I want to avoid cross contamination when touching the pump. This product works perfectly. It gives right amount of forming soap and the sensor works great. I also like the clean design. Overall, I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: ZC

customer_reviews.title: Was good while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: I bought four of these and the first one just went. It just stopped working - I thought the batteries were weak and I changed them but that wasn’t it. Then I thought the sensor was dirty and cleaned it but that wasn’t it. We tried everything but it just stopped working. It sad because I have four of them and now I’m just going to be waiting for the others to break. Hoping it was just a fluke thing.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Just received this dispenser and I’m not impressed at all. I put brand new batteries in it and filled with foaming soap solution. It turned on but no soap came out. The pump worked but only put out air, no soap. I checked the batteries and soap tube, nothing seemed to be wrong. Now the on light flashes white and red. The user manual is pretty useless and when I tried to e-mail customer service, it was rejected because the address was invalid. So as of now, I wasted $20 and can’t reach the company for any support.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it is broken after barely after a month
customer_reviews.text: only after a month, its sensor stopped working. i can't even return it since it has passed the return window.
customer_reviews.author: gmming

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great, Until It Didn’t
customer_reviews.text: I really loved this soap dispenser at first. It lasted 3 months and all of a sudden stopped working even with brand new batteries. Too late to send it back, so now I’m out $30 for a useless soap dispenser
customer_reviews.author: Amber Kaase

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 4 months
customer_reviews.text: The headline says it all and like other reviews, longevity seems to be an issue with this. Also like other reviews, threw in trash and ordered another brand!
customer_reviews.author: T. Sherer

customer_reviews.title: Updated Review
customer_reviews.text: The first dispenser we received quit working after four months. The seller contacted me after my review and sent a new dispenser. It is working fine and hopefully will continue to function as advertised. I really like this style better than any others I have seen on Amazon and have received compliments on it. Thanks so much for sending us a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Elainen

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I use this by my kitchen sink. The motion sensor easily works once you put your hands by it. It releases just the right amount of soap. Never need to touch anything. I plan to buy one for every sink in my house.
customer_reviews.author: Julie J. Lovelace

customer_reviews.title: excellent product
customer_reviews.text: We're really pleased with the dispenser with one important caution. Don't use any soap that includes any sort of particles such as a suspended glitter that is sometimes added. Otherwise a 5:1 water to soap mix works well with most commercial hand soaps.
customer_reviews.author: June Cook

customer_reviews.title: Attractive, Easy to use and Simple to keep filled.
customer_reviews.text: Works well, attractive design and is easy to use. Basically, all plastic construction so its long term functionality may be a future issue. Time and daily use will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Jagman1

customer_reviews.title: works very well
customer_reviews.text: simple & effective dispenser. no complaints at all. only 1 suggestion would be to add a 3rd setting for an On/Off switch that way when refilling it you wont accidentally trip the sensor.
customer_reviews.author: SM347

customer_reviews.title: Do not even try to use rechargeable batteries, they will get stuck.
customer_reviews.text: Overall great product, just wish it supported rechargeable batteries. The battery cavities are a hair too thin and will cause rechargeable batteries to get stuck in there (and they don't even reach the connectors).
customer_reviews.author: Erik R.

customer_reviews.title: Rechargeable batteries are a no go
customer_reviews.text: I love the device with the exception of one thing that has been mentioned in multiple other reviews...it doesn't accept rechargeable batteries. Aeakey, please contact me to discuss resolution.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Waltz

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money only lasted a month
customer_reviews.text: This item stop working right after 2 month of use. I Bought another one from a different company right before this [see second image] and its working excellent still. But this one only lasted a month. Would not recommend or buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Royal

customer_reviews.title: Great company and customer service
customer_reviews.text: Great company to work with. I originally ordered this soap dispenser in February 2020. I failed to contact the company within the 30 day timeframe. Short version I was missing the battery compartment door and didn’t realize it. I contacted the company on 9/9 to explain my situation and asked if I could receive the battery compartment door. I was then advised I would receive my item on 9/17. Not only did they exceed expectations, they went above and beyond by sending me a whole new soap dispenser.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Bought these in February 2020. Love them especially during this pandemic time. BIG problem...filled them with soap today. Replaced batteries and they both stopped working. Cannot contact anyone and would like replacements after reading other reviews. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: R. Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Foaming Soap Dispenser
customer_reviews.text: Just bought the Aeakey Soap Dispenser for my bathroom. Received in good condition & easy to use. I like that you can adjust the soap amount. Don't know how long it will work considering I just started to use the dispenser in the past few days. Overall I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with this product! Set up was easy, just insert batteries, liquid soap, and water - that's all. It actually created foam from regular liquid soap that I had at home. Now, I don't have to worry about touching the dispenser with dirty hands- it does the work for me (sensor works flawlessly.) I bought two and would buy again if the need comes up. Shipped quickly and was well packaged. Great seller.
customer_reviews.author: shopamazon

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: The right size for are bathroom . Looks elegant, works great ,we all love it! Good purchase! We just bought two more and they are all working fine! Seems like very liable product!!
customer_reviews.author: Sandor Barat

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 1 month
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of these at the same time. One just stopped working after one month of use. We'll see how long the others last.
customer_reviews.author: MATT MUMPER

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. I’ve really enjoyed having this soap dispenser. I even purchased a 2nd one. My favorite is in the kitchen but pretty close tie in my daughter’s bathroom. When she used the one in the kitchen, she said “Mom if you buy one for me I’d wash my hands more.” Now what Mom would pass that by? Not me and she’s kept her side of the deal too.
customer_reviews.author: Holly from Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money on this product
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this soap dispenser for my classroom. I put some soap in the bottom, read and carefully inserted batteries but it would not dispense any soap and seems to not only have a bad seal around the opening for the tube but also has affected the battery compartment so that even when I replace the batteries with brand new ones, nothing works. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: PJ Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Super elegant design
customer_reviews.text: It requires 4 full charged AA batteries. You can use regular soap and add three times the same amount of water to make it foamier. It works perfectly and the foam feels amazing on my hands
customer_reviews.author: Latina

customer_reviews.title: Great for the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and great for the kitchen. I dislike having to put my dirty hands on the soap dispenser just to get the soap. This solves that issue.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia Dasgupta

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I’m in love with this gadget. It dispenses the right amount of foam every time. One less thing to avoid touching while developing good habits. .
customer_reviews.author: Materialmomny

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Very easy set up, put the battery in and was ready to go. Add soap and water. Very useful during this time for contactless soap dispenser, keeps hands clean.
customer_reviews.author: Lil

customer_reviews.title: If pump does not come on, use another brand of batteries
customer_reviews.text: I actually sent my first order back because it was not working. When second order did not work either, I tried another brand of batteries, and voila! now it works. No good: Amazon Basic rechargeable Good: Duracell non-rechargeable Upon close inspection you can see that the Amazon batteries are shaped just wrong for this soap dispenser.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent  product
customer_reviews.text: I had a little bit of trouble getting the batteries in but after that it has worked very well. The sensor and dispenser works much better that the one I had before this one. I would recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Sensor stopped working after 7 months.
customer_reviews.text: This was a great soap dispenser. It was easy to use and liked that the volume could be adjusted. After 7 months the hand sensor stopped working; thus no longer dispenses soap. There is no contact information in the instructions per item description.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Eggers

customer_reviews.title: Good one.
customer_reviews.text: This is really useful during this pandemic. It regulates the Amount of soap we are using especially when you have kids. Motion detection is working perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Ashok A

customer_reviews.title: Great soap pump
customer_reviews.text: Item works well. Have not had issues with it. Would recommend it. It does like batteries thought it goes through a set a month. And I'm the only one that uses it.
customer_reviews.author: Lt. Todd

customer_reviews.title: Stable source of Foam❗️😎
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and use. Very stable and responsive. I particularly like the fact that you can tap the on/off switch once or twice to determine the volume of soap foam.
customer_reviews.author: L. W. Crosley

customer_reviews.title: Don't need to be a magician
customer_reviews.text: Very nice automatic soap dispenser. No needing to be a magician to get it to give you soap. Just put your hand out and it's there
customer_reviews.author: Silva Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Died 1.5 months in!
customer_reviews.text: Going against the recommendations of many buyers here, I went ahead and bought the soap dispenser. Sadly, BOTH of my soap dispensers died within a day of each other. Like many others, the batteries are not the issue. The sensor or pump does not work. I've tried multiple times turning it off and on using the power button. Quite silly, because up until this point, I really love the product. No way should a product only last 1.5 months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good...when it worked 🙄
customer_reviews.text: Piece of crap stopped working after 4 months. Thought batteries were dying so changed them and it makes the noise like it will dispense soap but doesn’t dispense any. What a waste!!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Coole

customer_reviews.title: Best Foamy Soap Dispenser yet
customer_reviews.text: I'd been looking for a new foamy soaper for a while (Method is only so-so). Saw the Aeakey and tried it. Have it in my bathroom and use it several times a day (more now with the strong emphasis on had washing). Great, full lather (3-1 Pure Castile) and works "the same" every time. I'll get more!
customer_reviews.author: John Legrande

customer_reviews.title: Lovely foaming soap dispenser!!
customer_reviews.text: I use it in my bathroom. It's very simple to use. I use 6:1 water to soap ratio and it foams perfectly. The motion detector sensor works great and it can be switched off for cleaning and other purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Mohd

customer_reviews.title: A great Foaming touch-free automatic soap dispenser
customer_reviews.text: I love this foaming soap dispenser. It saves soap because you put about 1/3 soap, and 2/3 water. It works well, and looks nice. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a dispenser for our guest bath that didn’t require touching. This work well so far. The on/off is a bit finicky but works fine otherwise. I just used 50/50 I liquid soap and water with no problems. Much cheaper than the simple human versions.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Efficient and Handy!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for dish soap at my kitchen sink. The product came in very nice packaging with easy to follow instructions. (The print is a little small--you'll definitely need your reading glasses). It has a very nice feature of being able to set how much soap is dispensed per squirt. The base is sturdy and it stands well.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald M. Field

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product. works very well. We use it at our kitchen sink. It gets a lot of use because we are constantly washing our hands!
customer_reviews.author: markus3

customer_reviews.title: Maybe worth it for a few months?
customer_reviews.text: Definitely garbage. Great while it worked. Lasted a few months. Broke for unknown reason - it seemed like it ran out of batteries, but I replaced them and it still won’t work. At the same time it just so happened that tightening the top back on (with pretty standard force) broke the top part of the soap reservoir too. Really disappointed to add more plastic to the landfill...
customer_reviews.author: M. Darrow

customer_reviews.title: 2 out of the 4 purchased broke within 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 4 of these...2 in April and 2 in May... 2 have already broke and I cannot contact seller for replacement. I really like these a lot I don't understand why they keep breaking at the base. This is a must have for my massage therapy business to be contactless. I would appreciate a replacement...not sure if that is possible. If seller replaces I will update my review otherwise buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Stroud

product_meta.title: Aeakey Soap Dispenser, Electric Automatic Foaming Soap Dispenser Touchless Battery Operated Adjustable Soap Dispenser Volume Control Switch for Bathroom Kitchen Toilet Office Hotel
feature_bullets: FULLY AUTOMATIC AND TOUCHLESS — Touchless foaming soap dispenser with high foam and low foam modes to better meet your requirements. Uses infrared sensors with a fully automatic sensing system, dispenses soap with a wave of the hand.

EASY OPERATION BY ONE BUTTON — Turn on the device, press the operations button once. To turn off, long-press for 2 seconds. Repeatedly press the operation button to adjust the amount of soap dispensed.
UNIVERSAL DESIGN — Clean, modern design allows for effortless integration into your modern kitchen, toilet, office, hotel, or any room where sanitized hands is important.

PRECAUTIONS — Foaming Hand Sanitizer can be loaded directly into the automatic Hand Soap Dispenser. The Non-foaming Hand Sanitizer needs to be diluted before loading the automatic Hand Soap Dispenser, with a dilution ratio of 1:3. Shake the bottle to evenly mix the diluted liquid.

GUARANTEE AND AFTER-SALES SERVICE —If you happen to feel unsatisfied with the use of our soap dispenser, please contact us and we will do our best to provide a solution for you.(Customer service contact information is provided on the middle page of the instruction) Including returns or refunds for any quality issues.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars854 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
